ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The breadth and intricacy of topics discussed was by far the best aspect of this course.
Comprehensive and intellectual survey of sustainability issues with a practical mission. Deep and broad exposure to diverse student and author views.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Better time-management and organization of in-class discussions

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
Why did you take this course?
comments: To learn of the origins of sustainability thinking and the expectations as to where sustainability thinking is headed.
To read seminal sustainability works, help instructor in mission of curriculum design, and discuss meaningful topics with classmates.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes and more. I was exposed to many critical readings that are vital to any person's environmental and societal reasoning skills.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Group work was an important part of the synthetic aspect of the course.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Since this was a course to design an undergraduate course on sustainability for the upcoming fall semester, I am led to believe that this course will not be offered again. But for those interested in sustainability, Dan Esty is a phenomenal resource. The discussions were always enlightening and the reading material was thorough.

I do not believe this course is intended to be offered again, but would recommend for anybody wishing to get deep and broad exposure to sustainability topics, and to meaningfully discuss these issues.
